reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Geneva surrounded by stunning fall colors. Parks like La Grange, Eaux-Vives, and the slopes of Mont Salève offer vibrant golden and red hues. Vineyards nearby are also picturesque.
Enjoy Geneva's attractions (museums, Old Town) with significantly fewer tourists than summer. Benefit from potentially lower prices for flights/accommodation.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Crisp Air for City & Nature Walks
reasons_to_visit.details: Invigorating cool air makes October ideal for exploring the Old Town, walking along Lake Geneva's promenades, or taking walks on Mont Salève (lower trails).
October often sees the start of the main cultural season, with performances at the Grand Théâtre, Victoria Hall, and potentially special exhibitions opening in museums.
Cooler, potentially damp weather is ideal for spending time in Geneva's world-class museums (Art & History, Red Cross, Patek Philippe, Ethnography) and exploring watch boutiques.
Enjoy warming up in Geneva's charming cafes (especially in Carouge or the Old Town) with hot chocolate, and savor seasonal cuisine like game ('chasse') or pumpkin dishes.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Temperatures drop (avg highs ~15°C/59°F). Increased chance of rain, overcast skies, and persistent low cloud/fog ('stratus'), especially near the lake and later in the month.
Days shorten considerably, particularly after daylight saving time ends late October, limiting time for outdoor activities and sightseeing.
Persistent fog often hides views of the Jet d'Eau, the lake, Mont Blanc, and surrounding mountains. Ascending Mont Salève might offer views above the fog.
Lake water is far too cold for swimming. Regular tourist boat schedules (CGN) transition to reduced autumn/winter timetables.
Lower trails (Salève, vineyards) can be muddy. Higher mountain trails are generally unsuitable without proper equipment due to potential early snow/ice.
Packing layers, including sweaters, a warm and waterproof/windproof jacket, scarf, and waterproof footwear, is essential.

weather.precipitation: Mix of crisp, sunny autumn days and cooler periods with rain showers. Fog risk increases. Daylight noticeably decreases.
weather.general_tips: Pack adaptable layers: sweaters, waterproof jacket, comfortable walking shoes. Umbrella useful. Enjoy the fall colors.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate to Low shoulder season. Attractions are much quieter than summer.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season prices offer better value than peak summer.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant crisp autumn feel. Peak foliage likely early/mid-October. Good time for city exploration, museum visits, and enjoying fall scenery.

events_holidays.name: La Bâtie - Festival de Genève (Potential End)
events_holidays.date: Often ends early October (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: If the multidisciplinary arts festival extends into October, catch the final performances (music, dance, theater) at various venues.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official La Bâtie program if dates overlap.

unique_experiences.activity: Ascend Mont Salève for Autumn Views
unique_experiences.description: Take the cable car up Mont Salève to potentially see stunning autumn foliage across Geneva and the surrounding landscape (visibility permitting).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather/webcam for visibility/fog levels. Bring passport (France). Wear layers. Restaurant/cafe at top.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Musée d'Art et d'Histoire
unique_experiences.description: Explore Geneva's main museum covering fine arts, applied arts, and archaeology, perfect for a cooler autumn day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Permanent collection is free. Check opening times (closed Mondays).

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic cobblestone streets, visit St. Peter's Cathedral, enjoy the autumn atmosphere in Place du Bourg-de-Four with fewer crowds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Good activity regardless of weather.

unique_experiences.description: October marks the start of the game season ('La Chasse'). Look for restaurants offering specialty dishes featuring venison, wild boar, and autumnal accompaniments.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reservations recommended for popular restaurants offering 'Chasse' menus.

weather.precipitation: Higher chance of rain, persistent fog ('stratus'), and overcast days. Feels noticeably cooler. Daylight shortens significantly after clocks change.
weather.general_tips: Warm layers are essential: sweaters, warm waterproof/windproof jacket, hat/scarf useful. Waterproof shoes recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season. Attractions are generally quiet. Geneva's autumn school break ('vacances d'automne') might slightly increase local family presence at museums.
tourism_level.pricing: Good low season value usually available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late autumn sets in. Can be atmospheric with fog over the lake, but requires embracing cooler, darker conditions. More focus on indoor activities.

events_holidays.name: End of Daylight Saving Time
events_holidays.description: Clocks go back one hour ('winter time'), making evenings arrive very early.
events_holidays.notes: Plan outdoor activities for earlier in the day.

events_holidays.name: Halloween
events_holidays.description: Not a traditional Swiss/Genevan holiday, but observed commercially with some shop decorations, themed parties in clubs/bars, and potentially pumpkin displays.
events_holidays.notes: No public holiday or widespread closures. Check specific venues for events.

events_holidays.name: Geneva Autumn School Break ('Vacances d'automne')
events_holidays.date: Usually one or two weeks in late October (check specific dates)
events_holidays.description: Local schools are closed. May see slightly more families at museums or indoor attractions.
events_holidays.notes: Minimal impact on overall tourist crowds.

unique_experiences.description: Delve into the world of high-end watchmaking and enamelling. A fascinating indoor experience for a potentially grey day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 1.5-2 hours. Check opening times (often closed Sun/Mon). Audio guide available.

unique_experiences.description: Spend an afternoon browsing the unique artisan shops, galleries, and bookstores in Carouge, stopping for a warm drink in a cozy cafe.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by tram. Best explored Tue-Sat when most shops are open.

unique_experiences.activity: Atmospheric Walk by Foggy Lake Geneva
unique_experiences.where: Quai du Mont-Blanc, Quai Wilson, Jardin Anglais
unique_experiences.description: Experience the unique, moody atmosphere of the lake shrouded in autumn fog ('stratus').
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Dress very warmly for the damp and potential wind ('bise'). The Jet d'Eau may not be visible or operating in fog/high wind.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy a Cozy Bar or Tearoom
unique_experiences.description: As evenings draw in, find a welcoming bar for an aperitif or a traditional tearoom for pastries and hot drinks.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Look for places with comfortable interiors and a warm ambiance.
